headline: Strong Rally Continues in Ethereum: Analyst Shares His Target Price Level -‚ÄúIt No Longer Seems Unrealistic‚Äù
summary: After nearly a year in the shadow of memecoins and rival blockchains, Ethereum (ETH) is regaining momentum. Rising nearly 50% in the last 60 days, analysts say it still has growth potential. Mateusz Kara, CEO of crypto payment company Ari10, stated that the recent rise in the Ethereum chart is due to investors pricing in this growth in advance, adding, ‚ÄúEthereum reaching $7,000 no longer seems unreal.‚Äù Ethereum traded at $3,600 today. Ethereum's rise comes amid a general rally, with the crypto market cap surpassing $4 trillion for the first time. As the second-largest crypto asset after Bitcoin, Ethereum has recently attracted increasing interest, particularly from institutional investors. Related News: Donald Trump's Son and Binance Founder CZ Posts About BTC as Bitcoin Price Dips Below $118,000 Coinbase analysts noted that this preference stems not only from diversification but also from a search for yield. The report, published today, stated: ‚ÄúMany companies are aiming to generate returns by staking their Ethereum holdings. Some are even locking their supply through DeFi integration, symbolizing a shift from speculative trading to strategic asset allocation.‚Äù Mateusz Kara also said that the GENIUS Act, recently signed by President Trump, presents a ‚Äúhuge opportunity that could significantly increase‚Äù the valuation of blockchains hosting stablecoins. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Strong Rally Continues in Ethereum: Analyst Shares His Target Price Level -‚ÄúIt No Longer Seems Unrealistic‚Äù

headline: Charles Schwab is set to begin spot Bitcoin and Ethereum trading
summary: Charles Schwab, the US brokerage firm with $10.7 trillion under management, is set to roll out spot Bitcoin and Ethereum trading. According to the company‚Äôs CEO, Rick Wurster, both BTC and ETH will become meaningful long-term growth drivers for the company. Wurster initially revealed Schwab‚Äôs plans to start spot crypto trading last November and reiterated the plans in the firm‚Äôs Spring 2025 Business Update. At the time, he said that the deployment would depend on a better regulatory environment in the US. ‚ÄúOur expectation is that with the changing regulatory environment, we are hopeful and likely to be able to launch direct spot crypto and our goal is to do that in the next 12 months and we‚Äôre on a great path to be able to do that,‚Äù Wurster said. In addition to trading services, Wurster revealed that Schwab plans to launch a stablecoin. He said the firm is exploring multiple pathways to deliver this stablecoin. This suggests openness to partnerships, in-house development, or leveraging existing blockchain infrastructure. ‚ÄúStablecoins are likely to play a role in transacting on blockchains, and that‚Äôs something we do want to be able to offer,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe will have a stablecoin at some point.‚Äù The statement comes after the GENIUS Act, which is meant to regulate stablecoins, was passed on Thursday by the US House. Spot crypto trading volume dropped in Q2 Charles Schwab‚Äôs interest in crypto trading comes as spot crypto volume fell by 22% in the second quarter of 2025. Crypto spot trading volumes on major centralized exchanges (CEXs) fell from $5.3 trillion in Q4 2024 to $4.6 trillion in Q1 2025 and then fell even more to $3.6 trillion in Q2, according to data from TokenInsight. Crypto spot trading volume across major CEXs versus the price of Bitcoin. Source: TokenInsight Bitcoin‚Äôs price increased significantly in Q2, reaching 25% gain. This was due to inflows into Bitcoin funds and more companies using it. This is a big change from the 12% drop in Q1. However, Bitcoin dominance, at the same time, dropped by 4.36% over the past week to 61.84%. Meanwhile, Ether spot Ethereum exchange-traded funds saw their most significant daily net inflow on Wednesday, totaling $726.74 million. The inflows were led by $499 million into BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA, with eight out of nine ether funds reporting positive daily flows. Following the news today, Charles Schwab will join the London-based international banking group Standard Chartered, which launched a US dollar-paired Bitcoin and Ether spot trading service for institutional clients this week, including corporates, investors, and asset managers. Charles Schwab benefited from Trump‚Äôs tariffs Charles Schwab also revealed today that it benefited from a surge in trading activity around President Trump‚Äôs tariffs. The brokerage‚Äôs profits rose 60% in the quarter compared to a year ago. Also, late-quarter market bounce not only increased the amount of money that brokerages managed, but it also allowed companies like Schwab to charge higher fees. Schwab posted adjusted earnings per share of $1.14 while total client assets climbed 14% to $10.76 trillion. According to a statement, this is in comparison to the same period last year. Revenue from client trades also jumped 23% to $952 million. For the three months ending June 30, Charles Schwab made $2.13 billion, or $1.08 per share. This is in comparison to the $1.33 billion, or 66 cents per share, in the year-ago quarter. Daily average revenue trades just barely beat analysts‚Äô expectations at 7.57 million. Cryptopolitan Academy: Want to grow your money in 2025? Learn how to do it with DeFi in our upcoming webclass. Save Your Spot

headline: Bitcoin Miners Unleash Massive BTC Selling: What This Means for the Market
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Miners Unleash Massive BTC Selling: What This Means for the Market The world of cryptocurrency is always buzzing with activity, and if you‚Äôre keeping an eye on Bitcoin , you‚Äôve probably heard about the recent surge in selling activity from a crucial segment of the ecosystem: Bitcoin miners . This isn‚Äôt just a ripple; it‚Äôs a significant wave that has caught the attention of analysts and investors alike. Understanding why miners are selling and what it implies is key to navigating the current crypto landscape. What‚Äôs Behind the Surge in BTC Selling Volume? Recently, a report from the reputable on-chain data analytics platform, CryptoQuant, shed light on a remarkable development: BTC selling volume from miners has reached its highest point since April. Imagine a massive outflow of 16,000 BTC, making its way from miner wallets primarily to exchanges. This isn‚Äôt a small sum; it represents a substantial portion of Bitcoin‚Äôs daily trading volume and liquidity. CryptoQuant noted that this significant transfer occurred precisely as Bitcoin was achieving a new local high, a crucial detail that hints at the motivations behind these sales. Why Are Bitcoin Miners Selling Now? A Deep Dive into Their Motivations Miners are the backbone of the Bitcoin network, responsible for validating transactions and securing the blockchain. Their operations are capital-intensive, requiring significant investment in hardware, electricity, and infrastructure. So, when we see a spike in their selling activity, it‚Äôs worth asking: what‚Äôs driving this decision? Profit-Taking at Local Highs: One of the most straightforward reasons is profit realization. As Bitcoin reached a new high, it presented an opportune moment for miners to cash in on their accumulated BTC. This allows them to secure profits, especially those who have been HODLing through market fluctuations. Operational Costs and Upgrades: Mining is an expensive business. Miners constantly need to cover electricity bills, maintenance, and the costs of upgrading their hardware to remain competitive. Selling BTC is their primary way to fund these ongoing expenses. A large outflow could indicate a need to cover significant operational costs or to invest in newer, more efficient mining rigs. Pre-Halving Preparations: Although the most recent Bitcoin halving occurred in April 2024, miners often prepare for such events well in advance or adjust their strategies in the months following. A reduction in block rewards means less BTC earned per block, pushing miners to optimize their finances and potentially sell off existing holdings to ensure liquidity for future operations. Market Sentiment and Risk Management: Miners, like other large holders, also react to broader market sentiment. If there‚Äôs uncertainty or a perception that the market might pull back after hitting a high, selling some holdings can be a form of risk management to protect against potential future price declines. The Power of On-Chain Analytics: Unpacking Miner Behavior This entire insight into miner selling wouldn‚Äôt be possible without on-chain analytics . Platforms like CryptoQuant provide invaluable transparency into the blockchain, allowing us to observe the flow of assets in real-time. By tracking wallet movements, exchange inflows/outflows, and specific entity behaviors (like miners), analysts can gain a deeper understanding of market dynamics that are otherwise opaque. Consider the benefits of such data: Early Warning Signals: Large miner outflows to exchanges can sometimes precede increased selling pressure in the market. While not always indicative of a price crash, it‚Äôs a signal worth monitoring. Understanding Supply Dynamics: Knowing how much BTC miners are holding or selling helps in assessing the potential supply coming onto the market, which directly impacts liquidity and price. Revealing Market Psychology: Miner behavior often reflects their outlook on Bitcoin‚Äôs future price. Their willingness to sell at certain levels provides insights into their collective sentiment and financial strategies. Without these sophisticated tools, much of the inner workings of the crypto market would remain a mystery, making informed decision-making significantly harder for both retail and institutional investors. What is the Bitcoin Price Impact of Such Selling? When a significant amount of BTC moves to exchanges, it typically indicates an intent to sell. This increased supply on exchanges, if met with insufficient buying demand, can exert downward pressure on the Bitcoin price impact . While 16,000 BTC is a large sum, the overall market liquidity for Bitcoin is also substantial, especially during bull markets. Historically, miner selling can contribute to short-term price corrections or consolidate price action. However, it‚Äôs crucial to remember that miner selling is just one of many factors influencing Bitcoin‚Äôs price. Institutional buying, macroeconomic factors, regulatory news, and retail investor sentiment all play equally important roles. In the context of Bitcoin hitting a new local high, this selling could be seen as healthy profit-taking, preventing the market from overheating too quickly. It allows new buyers to enter at potentially lower prices, contributing to a more sustainable price discovery process. Navigating Current Crypto Market Trends For investors, understanding these crypto market trends is vital. The miner selling volume highlights the inherent volatility and the complex interplay of supply and demand in the digital asset space. It‚Äôs a reminder that even foundational participants like miners are strategic actors, responding to market conditions to optimize their financial positions. Actionable Insights for Investors: Monitor On-Chain Data: While not every investor needs to be an on-chain expert, being aware of major reports from platforms like CryptoQuant can provide valuable context. Don‚Äôt Panic Sell: A single data point, even a significant one like miner selling, rarely dictates the entire market direction. Look at the broader picture and long-term trends. Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): For many, consistently investing a fixed amount over time, regardless of short-term price fluctuations, remains a robust strategy. Diversify and Research: Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket. Research different cryptocurrencies and understand their fundamentals. Conclusion: A Glimpse into Bitcoin‚Äôs Evolving Dynamics The recent surge in Bitcoin miner selling volume is a significant event, offering a rare glimpse into the operational realities and strategic decisions of those who secure the network. Driven by profit-taking, operational needs, and a keen eye on market highs, these sales underscore the dynamic nature of the crypto ecosystem. Thanks to advanced on-chain analytics, we can now observe and interpret these crucial movements, gaining a clearer picture of potential supply shifts and market sentiment. While the immediate Bitcoin price impact might involve some short-term pressure, it‚Äôs often a healthy part of market cycles, allowing for liquidity and new capital to flow in. As the crypto market continues to evolve, staying informed about these fundamental behaviors will be key to making sound investment decisions. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What does it mean when Bitcoin miners are selling? A1: When Bitcoin miners sell, it typically means they are converting their newly mined or accumulated Bitcoin into fiat currency or other assets. This is often done to cover operational costs (like electricity and hardware), realize profits, or manage risk based on market conditions. Q2: How does miner selling affect the Bitcoin price? A2: Increased miner selling can add supply to the market, potentially creating downward pressure on the Bitcoin price, especially if buying demand doesn‚Äôt absorb the supply. However, the overall impact depends on the volume of sales relative to total market liquidity and other prevailing market factors. Q3: What are on-chain analytics and why are they important for understanding miner behavior? A3: On-chain analytics involve examining data directly from the blockchain, such as transaction volumes, wallet movements, and exchange flows. They are crucial for understanding miner behavior because they provide transparent, real-time insights into when and where miners are moving their Bitcoin, indicating their selling intentions or accumulation patterns. Q4: Is a high volume of miner selling a bearish signal for Bitcoin? A4: Not necessarily. While it can contribute to short-term selling pressure, a high volume of miner selling, especially after a price rally, can also be interpreted as healthy profit-taking or necessary funding for operations and upgrades. It‚Äôs one data point among many that investors should consider, rather than a sole indicator of a bearish trend. Q5: How can investors track Bitcoin miner activity? A5: Investors can track Bitcoin miner activity through various on-chain analytics platforms like CryptoQuant, Glassnode, and Arkham Intelligence. These platforms provide dashboards and reports that visualize miner balances, outflows to exchanges, and other relevant metrics. Enjoyed this deep dive into Bitcoin miner activity and its market implications? Share this article with your friends, family, and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media to help them stay informed about the latest trends shaping the digital asset world! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Bitcoin Miners Unleash Massive BTC Selling: What This Means for the Market first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: SharpLink Gaming To Buy $5 Billion In Ethereum: Supply Shock Incoming?
summary: Ethereum is undergoing a bullish expansion, pushing above the $2,650 level and holding support above $2,600‚Äîa move that reinforces investor confidence across the broader crypto market. As ETH shows signs of sustained strength, institutional interest is ramping up. On Thursday, SharpLink Gaming (Nasdaq: SBET) made headlines by deepening its commitment to Ethereum. In a prospectus supplement filed with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the company revealed it has raised the ceiling on the amount of common stock it can sell from $1 billion to $5 billion. This strategic move is part of SharpLink‚Äôs treasury plan centered on accumulating ETH, making it one of the first Nasdaq-listed companies to adopt such a bold Ethereum-focused financial strategy publicly. The news arrives as ETH continues to lead altcoins in recovery, outperforming major peers with growing volume and strong technical momentum. Ethereum‚Äôs network fundamentals and price action are aligning with an expanding institutional narrative. As traditional companies like SharpLink integrate ETH into their balance sheets, the stage could be set for a broader wave of corporate crypto adoption, especially if Ethereum maintains its hold above current levels and confirms a bullish macro trend. SharpLink Becomes Largest Corporate Holder Of Ethereum SharpLink Gaming has officially become the largest corporate holder of Ethereum. In its latest prospectus supplement filed with the US SEC on July 17, 2025, the company confirmed that it has increased the total amount of common stock it may sell under its Sales Agreement with A.G.P./Alliance Global Partners to $6 billion. This figure includes the initial $1 billion under the May 30 prospectus and an additional $5 billion authorized by the recent supplement. These proceeds are being directed to Ethereum purchases as part of SharpLink‚Äôs crypto treasury strategy. As of today, the company holds 280,706 ETH‚Äîvalued at approximately $1 billion‚Äîon its balance sheet. This bold allocation not only positions SharpLink as a pioneer in corporate Ethereum adoption but also places significant upward pressure on ETH‚Äôs long-term scarcity. At current issuance rates, it would take the Ethereum network approximately 2.5 years to produce 1,436,000 ETH‚Äîthe equivalent volume SharpLink could accumulate if the full $6 billion were converted into ETH at today‚Äôs prices. This aggressive strategy signals growing confidence in Ethereum‚Äôs role as a long-term store of value and infrastructure for Web3. It could also mark a turning point in corporate crypto accumulation beyond Bitcoin. ETH Price Action Details: Key Levels To Watch Ethereum (ETH) is showcasing a powerful bullish structure on the daily chart, surging to $3,606.38 with a 3.64% gain on the day. After breaking through the long-standing resistance around $2,850, ETH confirmed the breakout with strong volume, suggesting conviction behind the move. Price is now significantly above the 50, 100, and 200-day simple moving averages‚Äîcurrently at $2,640, $2,359, and $2,475, respectively, indicating a full bullish trend alignment across timeframes. The chart shows a clear breakout from a consolidation phase that lasted for several weeks. Once ETH reclaimed $2,850 and flipped it into support, momentum accelerated. Since then, ETH has printed several large-bodied candles with minimal wicks, a sign of aggressive buying. Volume has surged in recent days, reinforcing the strength of this rally. The current price action suggests a market driven by institutional participation, likely influenced by macro developments like ETF inflows and regulatory clarity in the US. Featured image from Dall-E, chart from TradingView

headline: Unlocking Potential: Cointelegraph Predicts Epic Altcoin Season Ahead
summary: BitcoinWorld Unlocking Potential: Cointelegraph Predicts Epic Altcoin Season Ahead Are you ready for the next big wave in the crypto world? For months, Bitcoin has dominated headlines, but a compelling new report from Cointelegraph suggests a significant shift is on the horizon. Get ready to explore the highly anticipated Altcoin Season , a period where digital assets beyond Bitcoin could see explosive growth and reshape your portfolio. What is Altcoin Season and Why Does it Matter for Your Portfolio? The term ‚Äò Altcoin Season ‚Äò is a widely discussed phenomenon in the cryptocurrency space, referring to a period when alternative cryptocurrencies (altcoins) significantly outperform Bitcoin. While Bitcoin often leads market rallies, its dominance typically gives way to altcoins once it consolidates or experiences reduced volatility. This capital rotation allows investors to seek higher returns in the more volatile, yet potentially more rewarding, altcoin market. Historically, an altcoin season typically unfolds in stages: first, Bitcoin experiences a strong rally, attracting new capital into the crypto ecosystem. After Bitcoin‚Äôs initial surge, its price stabilizes, and investors begin to reallocate profits or new capital into larger-cap altcoins, then mid-cap altcoins, and finally, smaller, more speculative projects. This cascading effect can lead to parabolic gains across a wide range of digital assets. Why does this matter to you? Because identifying and participating in an altcoin season can offer unparalleled opportunities for portfolio growth. Unlike Bitcoin, which has a larger market capitalization and tends to move slower, many altcoins, especially those with smaller market caps, can experience percentage gains that are several multiples higher during these periods. This is the time when strategic diversification and keen market observation can truly pay off. The Crucial $1.5 Trillion Crypto Market Cap Milestone: What Does it Mean? According to the latest Cointelegraph Report , the total crypto market capitalization, excluding Bitcoin, has now reached a significant milestone: $1.5 trillion. This figure is not just a number; it represents a critical resistance line that was last tested in January of this year. Breaking through such a formidable resistance level is a strong bullish signal for the broader altcoin market. A resistance line acts as a ceiling for prices, where selling pressure has historically prevented further upward movement. When this barrier is breached, it often indicates a fundamental shift in market sentiment and buying pressure, paving the way for further gains. The fact that the altcoin market has re-approached and potentially surpassed this level suggests renewed confidence and increasing capital inflows. Furthermore, the publication explained that this market cap is expected to surpass its all-time high of $1.72 trillion in the long term. Reaching and exceeding this previous peak would not only confirm the bullish trend but also signal a new phase of expansion for altcoins, potentially leading to unprecedented valuations for many projects. This upward trajectory suggests a maturing market, attracting both retail and institutional interest beyond Bitcoin. Bitcoin‚Äôs Shifting Dynamics: The Impact of Decreasing Bitcoin Whale Deposits One of the key indicators signaling the potential for an altcoin rally is the changing behavior of Bitcoin whales. The Cointelegraph Report highlights that Bitcoin Whale Deposits on exchanges are decreasing, alongside a reduction in Bitcoin selling pressure. This trend is crucial for understanding capital flow within the crypto market. When Bitcoin whales (large holders of BTC) deposit their holdings onto exchanges, it often signifies an intention to sell, which increases selling pressure and can lead to price declines. Conversely, a decrease in these deposits suggests that whales are either holding onto their Bitcoin or moving it off exchanges into cold storage, indicating a long-term bullish outlook or a lack of immediate selling intent. This reduction in selling pressure creates a more stable environment for Bitcoin, allowing capital to seek opportunities elsewhere. This dynamic is often referred to as ‚Äòcapital rotation.‚Äô As Bitcoin stabilizes or experiences slower growth after its initial run, large investors and traders begin to look for assets with higher growth potential. This capital then flows into altcoins, driving up their prices. The reduced selling pressure on Bitcoin effectively ‚Äòfrees up‚Äô liquidity and attention, directing it towards the diverse and innovative altcoin ecosystem. It‚Äôs a natural progression in the crypto market cycle, and the current signals strongly point towards this rotation favoring altcoins. Insights from the Cointelegraph Report: A Glimpse into the Future of Altcoins The Cointelegraph Report provides a compelling narrative for the upcoming market cycle, emphasizing the unique confluence of factors aligning to favor altcoins. Their analysis extends beyond mere technical indicators, delving into the underlying market psychology and capital movements that drive significant shifts. Key takeaways from their findings include: Sustained Market Growth: The consistent increase in the crypto market cap (excluding Bitcoin) underscores a broader acceptance and utility of digital assets beyond the pioneer cryptocurrency. This indicates that the market is not solely reliant on Bitcoin‚Äôs performance for its overall health. Decreased Bitcoin Dominance: As capital flows out of Bitcoin and into altcoins, Bitcoin‚Äôs market dominance (its share of the total crypto market cap) tends to decrease. This is a classic sign of an impending altcoin season, as investors seek higher risk-adjusted returns in the broader market. Macroeconomic Factors: While not explicitly detailed in the brief, Cointelegraph‚Äôs broader analysis often incorporates macroeconomic trends, such as interest rates, inflation, and global liquidity, which can influence investor appetite for risk assets like cryptocurrencies. Favorable macro conditions can amplify altcoin gains. Innovation Driving Value: The report implicitly acknowledges the continuous innovation within the altcoin space, from decentralized finance (DeFi) to non-fungible tokens (NFTs), Layer-2 solutions, and new blockchain paradigms. These developments create real-world utility and demand, attracting fresh capital. The publication‚Äôs long-term outlook suggests that the altcoin market is not just poised for a temporary surge but for a sustained period of growth that could see it eclipse previous highs. This forward-looking perspective encourages investors to consider the long-term potential of diversified crypto portfolios. The Potential for an Altcoin Market Surge: Is 400% Possible? Perhaps the most exciting prediction from the Cointelegraph Report is the bold forecast by one market expert: the total altcoin market cap could rise to $5 trillion in this cycle. This would represent an astonishing 400% increase from current levels. While such a projection might seem ambitious, understanding the dynamics of the crypto market makes it a plausible, albeit high-risk, scenario. To put a 400% increase into perspective, imagine the current $1.5 trillion altcoin market cap quadrupling. This would mean a massive influx of new capital, likely driven by both retail FOMO (fear of missing out) and increasing institutional adoption of a wider range of digital assets. The last bull run saw many altcoins achieve gains far exceeding 400%, albeit from much lower bases. As the market matures and infrastructure improves, larger sums of money can move more efficiently. What could fuel such an incredible Altcoin Market Surge ? Institutional Inflows: As regulatory clarity improves and institutional products (like ETFs for altcoins) emerge, traditional finance could pour billions into the altcoin space. Technological Advancements: Breakthroughs in scalability, interoperability, and real-world applications (e.g., enterprise blockchain, tokenized assets) could unlock new use cases and drive demand. Retail Participation: Simplified access through user-friendly platforms and increased awareness could bring millions of new individual investors into the altcoin market. DeFi and NFT Growth: Continued innovation and adoption in decentralized finance and the non-fungible token sectors could drive significant value to their underlying altcoin ecosystems. Global Economic Factors: A weakening dollar or inflationary pressures could push investors towards alternative assets, with cryptocurrencies, particularly altcoins, being a prime beneficiary due to their high growth potential. While the potential for a 400% increase is thrilling, it‚Äôs crucial to remember that such predictions come with inherent volatility and risk. Market conditions can change rapidly, and not all altcoins will experience the same level of growth. Careful research and risk management are paramount. Navigating the Altcoin Landscape: Opportunities and Risks The prospect of an impending Altcoin Season presents a compelling opportunity for investors, but it‚Äôs essential to approach it with a balanced perspective, acknowledging both the potential rewards and the inherent risks. Understanding these facets will allow you to make more informed decisions and protect your capital. Opportunities: High Growth Potential: Altcoins, especially those with smaller market caps, can offer significantly higher percentage returns compared to Bitcoin during a bull run. Diversification: Investing in a variety of altcoins across different sectors (e.g., DeFi, gaming, AI, Layer-1s) can diversify your portfolio and spread risk. Innovation Exposure: Altcoins represent the cutting edge of blockchain technology, allowing investors to participate in and benefit from groundbreaking advancements. Early Adoption Advantage: Identifying promising projects early can lead to substantial gains as they gain traction and adoption. Challenges and Risks: Extreme Volatility: Altcoin prices can fluctuate wildly, experiencing rapid pumps and dumps. What goes up quickly can come down just as fast. Liquidity Issues: Smaller altcoins may have low trading volume, making it difficult to buy or sell large positions without impacting the price. Project Failure/Scams: Not all altcoin projects are legitimate or well-managed. Many fail, and some are outright scams, leading to total loss of investment. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for altcoins is still evolving in many jurisdictions, which can introduce unforeseen risks. Technical Complexity: Understanding the technology and utility behind various altcoins can be complex, requiring significant research. Actionable Insights for Investors: Given the exciting yet volatile nature of the altcoin market, here are some actionable insights: Do Your Own Research (DYOR): Never invest based on hype alone. Understand the project‚Äôs whitepaper, team, technology, use case, and community. Diversify Wisely: Instead of putting all your eggs in one basket, spread your investment across several promising altcoins in different sectors. Start Small: Especially if you‚Äôre new to altcoins, begin with smaller allocations that you can afford to lose. Risk Management: Set stop-loss orders to limit potential losses, and consider taking profits strategically as prices rise. Stay Informed: Follow reputable crypto news sources, analysts, and market trends to stay ahead. Long-Term vs. Short-Term: Decide if you are looking for quick gains (trading) or believe in the long-term potential of a project (investing). Your strategy will dictate your approach. Conclusion: Riding the Altcoin Wave with Caution and Conviction The signals are clear: the crypto market is evolving, and the stage is being set for what could be a monumental Altcoin Season . The breaking of the $1.5 trillion resistance line for the altcoin market cap, coupled with decreasing Bitcoin selling pressure and bullish expert predictions, paints a picture of immense opportunity. The potential for a 400% surge in the altcoin market cap to $5 trillion is a testament to the growing maturity and innovation within the broader cryptocurrency ecosystem. While the prospect of such gains is undoubtedly exciting, it is crucial for every investor to approach this period with both conviction and caution. The altcoin market is known for its volatility, and not every project will succeed. Success in this environment hinges on thorough research, strategic diversification, and robust risk management. By understanding the underlying market dynamics and making informed decisions, you can position yourself to potentially capitalize on this next thrilling chapter in the world of digital assets. As the crypto landscape continues to unfold, staying informed and adaptable will be your greatest assets. The future of finance is being rewritten, and altcoins are poised to play a significant role in that narrative. Are you ready to be a part of it? Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What exactly is ‚ÄúAltcoin Season‚Äù? Altcoin Season is a period in the cryptocurrency market cycle where altcoins (cryptocurrencies other than Bitcoin) experience significant price increases and generally outperform Bitcoin. It typically occurs after Bitcoin has had a strong rally and then enters a consolidation or stabilization phase, allowing capital to flow into the broader altcoin market. 2. How does Bitcoin‚Äôs performance affect altcoins? Bitcoin often acts as the market leader. When Bitcoin rallies, it usually brings new capital into the entire crypto market. Once Bitcoin‚Äôs price stabilizes or its dominance decreases, investors often reallocate profits or new funds into altcoins, seeking higher percentage gains. Conversely, a sharp decline in Bitcoin‚Äôs price can negatively impact altcoins, pulling them down. 3. What are the signs that Altcoin Season is approaching? Key indicators include: Bitcoin‚Äôs price stabilizing or consolidating after a significant rally, decreasing Bitcoin dominance (its market cap share relative to the total crypto market), an increase in the total altcoin market cap breaking through resistance levels, and a general surge in trading volumes and positive sentiment around altcoins. 4. Is a 400% increase in the altcoin market cap realistic? While ambitious, a 400% increase in the altcoin market cap to $5 trillion is considered realistic by some experts, given the historical volatility and growth potential of the crypto market. Such growth would be driven by factors like increased institutional adoption, technological advancements in altcoin projects, and renewed retail investor interest. However, it‚Äôs important to acknowledge the inherent risks and volatility involved. 5. What should I do to prepare for Altcoin Season? To prepare, focus on thorough research (DYOR) into promising altcoin projects with strong fundamentals, active development, and clear use cases. Diversify your portfolio across different sectors and market caps. Implement robust risk management strategies, such as setting stop-loss orders and taking profits incrementally. Avoid investing more than you can afford to lose, and stay updated with market news and trends. 6. What are the risks involved in altcoin investing? Altcoin investing carries significant risks, including extreme price volatility, potential for illiquidity (especially for smaller coins), the risk of project failure or scams, and evolving regulatory uncertainties. Due to their smaller market caps, altcoins can be more susceptible to price manipulation and sharp downturns compared to Bitcoin. If you found this article insightful, consider sharing it with your network! Help us spread awareness about the exciting potential and crucial considerations of the upcoming Altcoin Season by sharing on your favorite social media platforms. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping altcoin market price action. This post Unlocking Potential: Cointelegraph Predicts Epic Altcoin Season Ahead first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Bitcoin Standard to Go Public in Landmark SPAC Deal
summary: Bitcoin Standard Treasury Company (BSTR), a new firm focused on holding and growing BTC as a core asset , is set to become a publicly traded firm. The company has recently announced it has formed a merger with Cantor Equity Partners I (CEPO), a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC). The SPAC deal was formally signed on July 16. Once the deal closes, the new company will trade on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol BSTR. BSTR aims to build one of the biggest company-owned Bitcoin treasuries in the world. A Public Debut Backed by Major Bitcoin Holdings The merger is accompanied by a robust and well-planned funding structure that provides BSTR with a solid foundation in the public markets. When it launches, BSTR plans to hold 30,021 Bitcoin and raise to $1.5 billion in fiat-based private investment in public equity (PIPE) financing. This funding is set to come through a mix of equity, convertible securities, and direct Bitcoin contributions. These contributions will be made by trusted backers and founding shareholders advised by Blockstream Capital Partners. Additionally, CEPO‚Äôs trust account may contribute up to $200 million, contingent upon shareholder redemptions. This combined funding and Bitcoin holdings will place BSTR among the top four largest public corporate Bitcoin treasuries. It will rank just ahead of Metaplanet. Pioneers to Lead BSTR‚Äôs Treasury Vision Adam Back, a key figure in BTC history and co-founder of Blockstream, will serve as Chief Executive Officer. Back is recognized for creating Hashcash, the proof-of-work system referenced in Satoshi Nakamoto‚Äôs Bitcoin white paper. Sean Bill, a veteran in institutional crypto investment, will also serve as Chief Investment Officer. He is known for supporting one of the first Bitcoin allocations by a U.S. public pension fund and has experience integrating digital assets into large portfolios. Together, Back and Bill will guide BSTR to build a Bitcoin-centric treasury company that does more than hold digital assets. The company‚Äôs strategy involves building up its BTC holdings and also earning returns in Bitcoin. It also plans to offer advice to companies and governments that want to manage their treasuries using Bitcoin as a unit of account. The company will measure performance in BTC per share, rather than focusing on traditional fiat terms. Traditional Finance Meets the BTC Economy The announcement confirms previous reports that Cantor Fitzgerald had been involved in discussions to acquire over $3 billion in Bitcoin from Blockstream . Furthermore, the merger has received approval from both the BSTR and CEPO boards. The merger has received approval from both the BSTR and CEPO boards. To be finalized, it must also gain approval from CEPO shareholders and meet other standard conditions. CEPO will soon file the necessary documents with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. These documents will provide further details to investors and the public as the listing process continues. The post Bitcoin Standard to Go Public in Landmark SPAC Deal appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

headline: Donald Trump‚Äôs Son and Binance Founder CZ Posts About BTC as Bitcoin Price Dips Below $118,000

headline: Crucial CFTC Confirmation: What Brian Quintenz‚Äôs Vote Means for Crypto Regulation
summary: BitcoinWorld Crucial CFTC Confirmation: What Brian Quintenz‚Äôs Vote Means for Crypto Regulation The cryptocurrency world is abuzz with anticipation as a pivotal moment approaches for U.S. crypto regulation. Next Monday, the U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee is set to cast its vote on the CFTC Confirmation of Brian Quintenz as the next chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). This isn‚Äôt just another bureaucratic procedure; it‚Äôs a critical decision that could significantly shape the future of digital assets in America. As reported by Eleanor Terrett, host of the Crypto in America podcast, on X, this vote follows his confirmation hearing last month, and the implications for the crypto industry are immense. Understanding the Significance of CFTC Confirmation Why is the confirmation of a CFTC chairman such a big deal for those of us navigating the digital asset landscape? The CFTC plays a vital role in overseeing commodity markets, and increasingly, that includes various cryptocurrencies. While the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) often grabs headlines for its actions against crypto projects deemed securities, the CFTC has consistently asserted its jurisdiction over digital assets classified as commodities, such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. A confirmed chairman brings stability, clear direction, and potentially a more defined regulatory stance, which is something the crypto industry has long craved. The absence of a permanent, confirmed leader can lead to policy stagnation and uncertainty. For an industry as dynamic and rapidly evolving as crypto, clarity is paramount. This vote is about more than just filling a seat; it‚Äôs about setting the tone for how the U.S. government intends to supervise and interact with the burgeoning digital economy. Who is Brian Quintenz and What Does His Potential Role as Brian Quintenz CFTC Chairman Mean? Brian Quintenz is no stranger to the CFTC or the world of digital assets. He previously served as a Commissioner at the CFTC from 2017 to 2021, a period during which the agency began to significantly engage with cryptocurrencies. During his tenure, Quintenz was often viewed as a pragmatic voice, advocating for regulatory clarity while acknowledging the innovative potential of blockchain technology and digital assets. His past statements and actions suggest a nuanced approach to Brian Quintenz CFTC leadership. He has emphasized the importance of ensuring market integrity and protecting consumers, but also expressed a desire to avoid stifling innovation through overly burdensome regulations. For example, he has often highlighted the need for a principles-based approach rather than a rigid rulebook, which could offer flexibility for new technologies to flourish. His potential chairmanship could signal a continued emphasis on treating certain cryptocurrencies as commodities, potentially paving the way for more tailored regulatory frameworks. Key Aspects of Quintenz‚Äôs Stance: Innovation-Friendly: Generally seen as supportive of technological advancement in financial markets. Regulatory Clarity: Advocates for clear rules of the road for market participants. Commodity Focus: Tends to view Bitcoin and certain other digital assets as commodities, falling under CFTC purview. Market Integrity: Prioritizes robust market oversight to prevent manipulation and ensure fair trading. Navigating the Labyrinth of Crypto Regulation US The United States has famously struggled to establish a unified and comprehensive framework for Crypto Regulation US . This fragmented approach has often left businesses and investors in a state of limbo, unsure which rules apply to them. The primary players in this regulatory dance are the CFTC and the SEC, each with distinct mandates: Regulatory Body Primary Jurisdiction Role in Crypto Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) Commodity derivatives markets Oversees digital assets deemed as commodities (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum futures); aims to prevent fraud and manipulation in these markets. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Securities markets Oversees digital assets deemed as securities (e.g., many ICO tokens); focuses on investor protection and disclosure requirements. This dual-agency approach, while necessary given their distinct legal mandates, has often led to a lack of coordinated policy and enforcement. A strong, confirmed CFTC chairman, especially one with prior experience and a clear vision for crypto, could provide much-needed leadership and potentially foster greater inter-agency cooperation. This is crucial for the development of a coherent and effective regulatory framework that supports both innovation and investor protection. The Broader Implications for Digital Asset Oversight The outcome of this vote will have significant implications for Digital Asset Oversight . If Brian Quintenz is confirmed, his leadership could influence several key areas: 1. Market Integrity and Consumer Protection: The CFTC‚Äôs core mission includes preventing fraud and manipulation in the markets it oversees. With the increasing institutional interest and retail participation in crypto, robust oversight is essential. A confirmed chairman can push for clearer rules regarding derivatives, exchanges, and trading practices to ensure fair and transparent markets. This protects both individual investors and prevents systemic risks. 2. Innovation vs. Regulation: One of the perennial challenges in regulating emerging technologies is striking the right balance between fostering innovation and implementing necessary safeguards. Quintenz‚Äôs history suggests he leans towards enabling innovation while ensuring responsible development. His leadership could mean a regulatory environment that encourages new products and services in the digital asset space, rather than stifling them. 3. International Cooperation: Cryptocurrency markets are global. Effective digital asset oversight requires international cooperation among regulators. A stable and experienced leadership at the CFTC can strengthen the U.S.‚Äôs position in global dialogues, helping to shape consistent international standards and prevent regulatory arbitrage. 4. Institutional Adoption: Greater regulatory clarity from a confirmed CFTC chairman could significantly boost institutional confidence in the crypto market. Large financial institutions often hesitate to fully engage with digital assets due to regulatory uncertainty. A more predictable and well-defined regulatory landscape could unlock substantial capital and mainstream adoption. Why the Senate Agriculture Committee? You might be wondering, why is the Senate Agriculture Committee responsible for confirming the head of the CFTC? The answer lies in history. The CFTC was established in 1974 to regulate futures and options markets, which traditionally dealt with agricultural commodities like corn, wheat, and soybeans. Over time, its jurisdiction expanded to include financial derivatives, but its foundational link to agriculture meant that the Senate Agriculture Committee retained oversight. This historical connection means that the committee members, while perhaps not crypto natives, are deeply familiar with the complexities of commodity markets and the importance of transparent and fair trading. Their review process for a CFTC chairman involves scrutinizing the nominee‚Äôs understanding of market dynamics, regulatory philosophy, and commitment to the agency‚Äôs mission. Their vote is a crucial step in the checks and balances of the U.S. government, ensuring that key leadership positions are filled by qualified individuals. Challenges and Opportunities Ahead The confirmation of Brian Quintenz, if successful, presents both challenges and opportunities for the crypto ecosystem. One significant challenge remains the ongoing jurisdictional debate with the SEC. While Quintenz‚Äôs stance might clarify the CFTC‚Äôs position, a broader legislative solution is still needed to provide a truly comprehensive framework for all digital assets. However, the opportunities are substantial. A stable, experienced, and innovation-aware leader at the CFTC could accelerate the development of regulated crypto products, enhance market infrastructure, and foster greater trust among mainstream investors. It could also provide a clearer path for businesses looking to operate within U.S. borders, potentially attracting more investment and talent to the American crypto industry. What to Watch Next As the U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee prepares for its vote next Monday, the crypto community will be watching closely. The outcome will not only determine the next CFTC chairman but also offer a glimpse into the immediate future of U.S. crypto regulation. Stay tuned for updates, as this decision could be a turning point for how digital assets are treated in one of the world‚Äôs largest economies. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin‚Äôs price action. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is the CFTC and why is its chairman‚Äôs confirmation important for crypto? A1: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) is a U.S. independent agency that regulates the U.S. derivatives markets, including futures and options. It has asserted jurisdiction over certain digital assets, like Bitcoin and Ethereum, classifying them as commodities. The confirmation of its chairman is crucial because it provides stable leadership, sets the agency‚Äôs regulatory direction, and influences how digital assets are overseen in the U.S., impacting market clarity and innovation. Q2: Who is Brian Quintenz and what is his stance on cryptocurrencies? A2: Brian Quintenz previously served as a CFTC Commissioner from 2017 to 2021. He is generally seen as supportive of technological innovation and has advocated for regulatory clarity in the digital asset space. He tends to view Bitcoin and similar cryptocurrencies as commodities, aligning them under CFTC‚Äôs jurisdiction, and emphasizes the importance of market integrity while fostering responsible growth. Q3: How does the CFTC‚Äôs role in crypto regulation differ from the SEC‚Äôs? A3: The CFTC primarily oversees digital assets classified as commodities (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum futures) to prevent fraud and manipulation. The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), on the other hand, regulates digital assets deemed as securities (e.g., many ICO tokens), focusing on investor protection and disclosure requirements. This distinction often leads to jurisdictional complexities in the U.S. regulatory landscape. Q4: Why is the Senate Agriculture Committee involved in the CFTC chairman‚Äôs confirmation? A4: The CFTC was historically established to regulate agricultural commodity futures markets. Due to this foundational link, the Senate Agriculture Committee retains oversight of the agency and is responsible for confirming its chairman. This ensures that nominees are thoroughly vetted for their understanding of commodity markets and regulatory philosophy. Q5: What are the potential benefits of a confirmed CFTC chairman for the crypto industry? A5: A confirmed CFTC chairman can bring much-needed regulatory stability and clarity to the digital asset market. This can lead to increased institutional adoption, foster innovation by providing clear rules for businesses, enhance market integrity through robust oversight, and strengthen the U.S.‚Äôs position in international regulatory discussions regarding cryptocurrencies. Did you find this article insightful? Share it with your friends, colleagues, and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media to spread awareness about this crucial development in U.S. crypto regulation! This post Crucial CFTC Confirmation: What Brian Quintenz‚Äôs Vote Means for Crypto Regulation first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Ethereum ETF: BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA Records Unprecedented $544.94M Inflow
summary: BitcoinWorld Ethereum ETF: BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA Records Unprecedented $544.94M Inflow The world of digital assets is buzzing with excitement as institutional interest continues to surge, and a recent development involving BlackRock‚Äôs spot Ethereum (ETH) ETF, ETHA, has sent ripples across the market. On July 17, this groundbreaking financial product achieved an all-time high net inflow of a staggering $544.94 million, as reported by Trader T on X. This monumental achievement not only shattered its own previous record set just a day earlier on July 16, which stood at $489.14 million, but also underscored a growing appetite among traditional investors for exposure to the second-largest cryptocurrency. What does this unprecedented ETH inflow signify for the future of crypto, and why is the BlackRock ETHA ETF at the center of this financial revolution? Understanding the Phenomenon: What is a Spot Ethereum ETF? Before diving deeper into the implications of BlackRock‚Äôs record-breaking success, it‚Äôs crucial to grasp what a Spot Ethereum ETF entails. An Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) is a type of investment fund that trades on stock exchanges, much like stocks. A spot crypto ETF, specifically, holds the underlying cryptocurrency directly, rather than derivatives or futures contracts. This means that when you invest in the BlackRock ETHA ETF , you are essentially gaining exposure to the actual price movements of Ethereum without having to directly buy, store, or manage the digital asset yourself. This offers several key advantages: Accessibility: It opens up the crypto market to a wider range of traditional investors and institutions who might be hesitant to navigate the complexities of crypto exchanges and wallets. Security: The ETF provider handles the secure custody of the underlying ETH, alleviating concerns about hacks or lost private keys for individual investors. Liquidity: ETFs trade on regulated exchanges, providing high liquidity and ease of buying and selling throughout the trading day. Regulatory Clarity: For many institutional investors, investing through a regulated ETF structure provides the necessary compliance framework they require. The approval and launch of such products, especially from a financial giant like BlackRock, are often seen as a significant step towards mainstream adoption and legitimization of cryptocurrencies. The Numbers Speak: BlackRock ETHA ETF‚Äôs Soaring Inflows The recent figures for the BlackRock ETHA ETF are truly eye-opening. Let‚Äôs look at the rapid acceleration of inflows: BlackRock ETHA ETF Daily Net Inflows Date Net Inflow (USD) Notes July 16 $489.14 million Previous all-time high July 17 $544.94 million New all-time high This consistent upward trend in ETH inflow demonstrates a robust and growing demand. It‚Äôs not just a one-off spike but a sustained interest that indicates a deeper shift in investment strategies. Such significant capital allocation into a crypto-backed product from a firm of BlackRock‚Äôs stature sends a powerful signal to the global financial community. What‚Äôs Fueling This Massive ETH Inflow? Several factors likely contribute to the surging interest in the Ethereum ETF and the subsequent record inflows: Growing Institutional Confidence: As the crypto market matures and regulatory frameworks become clearer, more traditional financial institutions are gaining confidence in digital assets. BlackRock‚Äôs entry into the space provides a stamp of approval that resonates with other large players. Ethereum‚Äôs Ecosystem Strength: Ethereum remains the backbone of decentralized finance (DeFi), NFTs, and a vast array of decentralized applications (dApps). Its ongoing development, including the transition to Proof-of-Stake and upcoming upgrades, makes it an attractive long-term investment for those seeking exposure to innovation. Diversification from Bitcoin: While Bitcoin ETFs have seen immense success, investors are increasingly looking to diversify their crypto exposure beyond just Bitcoin. Ethereum, with its unique utility and market dominance, presents a compelling alternative. Market Momentum: A general positive sentiment in the broader crypto market, often driven by Bitcoin‚Äôs performance, tends to spill over into other major cryptocurrencies like Ethereum, attracting new capital. Ease of Investment: The simplicity of investing in an ETF compared to direct crypto purchases, coupled with the familiarity of traditional brokerage accounts, lowers the barrier to entry for many institutional and retail investors. The Broader Impact of a Successful Crypto ETF Landscape The success of the BlackRock ETHA ETF is not an isolated event; it‚Äôs part of a larger narrative of increasing institutional adoption of digital assets. The approval and performance of spot Bitcoin ETFs earlier this year set a precedent, demonstrating that there is significant demand for regulated crypto investment vehicles. The rapid accumulation of assets under management (AUM) by the ETHA ETF reinforces this trend for Ethereum specifically. This success could pave the way for: More Ethereum ETFs: Other asset managers may accelerate their efforts to launch their own spot Ethereum ETFs, leading to increased competition and potentially more diverse offerings for investors. Increased Liquidity for ETH: As more capital flows into the ETF, it indirectly contributes to the overall liquidity of Ethereum in the market, potentially leading to more stable price action. Further Regulatory Clarity: The continued operation and success of these ETFs may encourage regulators globally to develop more comprehensive and clear guidelines for the digital asset space. New Crypto ETF Products: The blueprint established by Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs could inspire the creation of ETFs for other major cryptocurrencies or even baskets of digital assets. Challenges and Considerations for the Ethereum ETF Market While the inflows are overwhelmingly positive, it‚Äôs important to consider potential challenges and nuances within the Crypto ETF space: Market Volatility: Cryptocurrencies are inherently volatile. While an ETF structure mitigates some operational risks, the underlying asset‚Äôs price fluctuations will directly impact the ETF‚Äôs value. Regulatory Scrutiny: The crypto market remains under close watch by regulators worldwide. Any shifts in policy could impact ETF operations or investor sentiment. Competition: As more Ethereum ETFs enter the market, competition for investor capital will intensify, potentially leading to fee wars or a fragmentation of inflows. Impact of Outflows: Just as large inflows can drive positive sentiment, significant outflows could create downward pressure or negative market perceptions. Investors should always conduct their own due diligence and understand the risks associated with any investment, including those within the burgeoning Crypto ETF sector. Looking Ahead: What‚Äôs Next for BlackRock ETHA ETF and Ethereum? The record-breaking ETH inflow into the BlackRock ETHA ETF is more than just a headline; it‚Äôs a testament to the evolving relationship between traditional finance and the decentralized world of cryptocurrencies. It signals a growing comfort level among institutional investors with digital assets as legitimate investment vehicles, moving beyond mere speculation to strategic allocation. As we move forward, market participants will be keenly watching: Sustained Inflows: Will the ETHA ETF continue to attract significant capital, or will inflows normalize? Price Action: How will these inflows translate into Ethereum‚Äôs price performance? Other ETF Filings: Will the success of BlackRock prompt other major asset managers to expedite their own Ethereum ETF applications? Regulatory Developments: Any further clarity or changes in regulations globally could significantly impact the market. The narrative is clear: Ethereum is solidifying its position as a cornerstone asset for institutional portfolios, and the ETF mechanism is proving to be a highly effective bridge for this integration. Conclusion: A New Era of Institutional Crypto Adoption BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA ETF hitting an unprecedented $544.94 million in net inflows is a watershed moment for the cryptocurrency industry. It not only highlights the immense institutional demand for Ethereum but also reinforces the growing acceptance of digital assets within traditional financial frameworks. This record ETH inflow is a powerful indicator of market maturity and confidence, paving the way for further integration of cryptocurrencies into mainstream investment portfolios. As the Spot Ethereum ETF landscape continues to evolve, we are witnessing a transformative period that promises to reshape how the world views and invests in digital assets. The future of crypto is increasingly intertwined with the very institutions that once viewed it with skepticism, signaling a new era of adoption and innovation. To learn more about the latest Ethereum ETF trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Ethereum institutional adoption. This post Ethereum ETF: BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA Records Unprecedented $544.94M Inflow first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team
